content.description:
Start below the undercut slab and move up on marginal holds to get established on the low-angled slab which steepens at the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide (2003) but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: North side of the boulder and just left of a catclaw.

content.description:
Start from a diagonal crack and some plates with marginal feet and climb the slanting arete with progressively better holds.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the east face at an arete.

content.description:
Start in the center of the patina patch and climb the "alligator skin" face above to an easy mantle finish. This problem is also useful as a downclimb from the boulder.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Center of the east face and 6' right of

Illicit Sweetie

.

content.description: Jump to the sloping lip, mantle.
content.location: On the left (South) side of the boulder.

content.description: Climb the left side of the alligator skin face via incut edges and buckets. Once past the start and your feet are established it's just sweet patina plates all the way to the top. Easy descent via incut patina jugs to the right or off the slabby north side of the boulder.
content.location: Center of the east face at the left edge of the patina patch.
